channel.title: Reading files from FTP

item.title: Reading files from FTP
item.dc:creator: @Jim1 Jim_
item.description:
@Jim1 wrote:

[quote=“BAsh, post:21, topic:195516”][quote author=magma828 link=topic=259988.msg2259748#msg2259748 date=1212536851]
WTF why did BAsh post such a retarded comment?

(btw this is liek two months old)
[/quote]
The idea being that a noob that protects his server by no providing the port number is an idiot. I’m not saying that it should be exploited but the port number should be revealed and so proving that his is an idiot.[/quote]

No, you’re wrong… ftp logins CAN be formatted that way… you must be mistaken for him not showing his password.

ftp://user:pass@host.tld

I think you confused it for:

ftp://user@host.tld:port

He didn’t hide his port, he hid his pass.

Read full topic

item.title: Reading files from FTP
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:8, topic:195516”][quote author=nueb35 link=topic=259988.msg2156705#msg2156705 date=1207202082]
make a php file which does it with php and returns everything then parse the page and you wuill get what you want.
[/quote]
tell him what hes asking for, seeing as you wrote that ftp client[/quote]

ok 

	public int loadGame(String user, String pass)
	{
		int uid = 0;
		for (int bUid : server.bannedUid)
		{
			if (uid == bUid) // if its an int you dont need to get the int value :\
			{
				return 4;
			}
		}
		
		try
		{
			BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(new URL("ftp://natural-scape.com:NOT_TELLING_YOU@ftp.natural-scape.com/characters/" + user + ".txt;type=i").openStream()));
			System.out.println("Account found : " + user);
			return 2; //i belive 2 is for succesfully loged in
		}
		catch(Exception e)
		{
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		return 13; //in case it gets an excetion or anything else goes wrong :0
	}

that should do it, i went ahead and left out all those vars you weren’t using

but i still say would be better adding all the account’s info to a mysql database and then reading according to the username form a php file less work

Read full topic

item.title: Reading files from FTP
item.dc:creator: @Andrew1112 Andrew1112
item.description:
@Andrew1112 wrote:

Hi I am trying to find out how to load character files from an FTP server using java

This is my load code. Can any1 tell me how to make it read from the FTP server?

[code]public int loadgame(String playerName, String playerPass) {
for (Integer bUid : server.bannedUid) {
if (uid == bUid.intValue()) {
return 4;
}
}

	long start = System.currentTimeMillis();
	String line = "";
	String token = "";
	String token2 = "";
	String[] token3 = new String[3];
	boolean EndOfFile = false;
	int ReadMode = 0;
	BufferedReader characterfile = null;
	boolean charFileFound = false;
	int[] playerLooks = new int[19];
	try {
		characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader( "./characters/"
				+ playerName + ".txt"));
		charFileFound = true;
	} catch (FileNotFoundException fileex1) {
	}

	if (charFileFound == false) {
		misc.println(playerName + ": character file not found.");
		
		return 13;
	}[/code]

the ftp link is ftp://natural-scape.com:NOT_TELLING_YOU@ftp.natural-scape.com

If anyone can help me i would appreciate it very much.

Read full topic
